definition: horse hindquarters/flattery/boot-licking
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
fart/flatulence/nonsense/(usu. in the negative) what/(not) a damn thing
to flatter/to fawn on/to butter sb up/toadying/bootlicking
toady/bootlicker

sentences.english: When I please my boss, I am ass-kissing.
sentences.chinese: 当我讨上司欢心的时候，我是拍马屁。

sentences.english: He's a little kiss-ass bastard who'll do anything to get ahead.
sentences.chinese: 那个小混蛋是个马屁精，只要能往上爬，他啥事都干。

sentences.english: Every knows that Sammy's the biggest apple-polisher in our company.
sentences.chinese: 大家都知道珊咪是我们公司最大的马屁精。

sentences.english: Ross: All right, so I don't know what sycophant means, but the rest is right.
sentences.chinese: 那我不知道“拍马屁”的意思，但余下的是对的。

sentences.english: I understand he's trying to butter me up, but I'm not takeing it.
sentences.chinese: 我清楚他想要拍我马屁，但我才不吃那一套。
他只是一个乐于拍马屁的人。

sentences.english: John is an apple-polisher ------ he always agrees with whatever the boss says.
sentences.chinese: 约翰是个马屁精，不管老板说什么，他都赞同。

sentences.english: In many cases, it is possible that there are other employees who merit these advantages more than the brown-noser.
sentences.chinese: 可是，在情况下，的员工比拍马屁者更有好处。

sentences.english: To seek favor or attention by flattery and obsequious behavior .
sentences.chinese: 用拍马屁和谄媚的态度来取悦，引起注意。

sentences.english: Sally: I’m not surprised. He’s such a brown-noser.
sentences.chinese: 我一点都不觉得惊讶，他可是个马屁精。

sentences.english: With a clatter, the flatterer shattered the chattering wattmeter in the chaos.
sentences.chinese: 卖啷一声，马屁精在杂沓中打碎了格格作响的瓦特表。

sentences.english: But he's so good at brown-nosing the boss.
sentences.chinese: 但是他最擅长的是拍老板的马屁。

sentences.english: The whip cracked down on the horse's rump.
sentences.chinese: 鞭子啪地一声抽在马屁股上。

sentences.english: I'll never force myself to lick other's boots.
sentences.chinese: 我绝不会免强自己去拍别人马屁。

definition: to flatter/to fawn on/to butter sb up/toadying/bootlicking
to fawn on/to flatter/to ingratiate oneself/flattery
toady/bootlicker
to praise/to speak highly of/compliment/praise
to smooth whiskers and pat a horse's bottom (idiom); to use flatter to get what one wants/to toady/boot-licking
to flatter/to toady
flattering and fawning (idiom)/sweet-talking
to praise/to applaud/to compliment
to ingratiate oneself with/to pander to
to urge on a horse by patting its bottom/fig. to encourage/same as 拍馬屁|拍马屁, to flatter or toady
to fawn on/to curry favor with/to make up to
to clap one's hands
to praise/to speak highly of/to commend
silent curse or disagreement/unspoken criticism
flattering words
brows raised in delight, eyes laughing (idiom); beaming with joy/all smiles
